purpose: The email announces the IEEE Annual Congress on Artificial Intelligence of Things (IEEE AIoT 2024), scheduled for July 24–26, 2024, in Melbourne, Australia. It provides important details regarding paper submissions, including deadlines for submission, notification of acceptance, and final manuscript submission. The conference aims to bring together universities, research centers, industries, and stakeholders to discuss the integration of AI and IoT technologies. It highlights various topics of interest for paper submissions, including AIoT architectures, applications, standards, and ethical concerns. Additionally, it mentions awards for best papers and potential journal publications for selected works.

conf_name_candidates.raw: IEEE Annual Congress on Artificial Intelligence of Things (IEEE AIoT 2024)
conf_name_candidates.evidence: IEEE Annual Congress on Artificial Intelligence of Things (IEEE AIoT 2024)

evidence_sentences: IEEE Annual Congress on Artificial Intelligence of Things (IEEE AIoT 2024)

IEEE AIoT 2024 aims at bringing together interested parties (universities, research centers, industries and stakeholders) from around the world working in the fields of AI and Internet of Things to exchange opinions, discuss brand-new ideas, developing innovative and emerging solutions, and establishing new collaborations.
The conference will focus on the following areas: AIoT Architectures, Frameworks, and Algorithms, AIoT Applications, Standards and Interoperability, and Ethics and Security.
Authors are cordially invited to submit their original papers within the eHealth area.
Three accepted papers will be selected for best paper awards.
Selected papers will be recommended to IEEE Internet of Things Journal (IF: 10.238) and Digital Communications and Networks (IF: 7.9) for potential fast-track publications.
